titles.title: Cardfight!! Vanguard: Link Joker Hen
カードファイト!! ヴァンガード リンクジョーカー編
CARDFIGHT!! ヴァンガード リンクジョーカー編
卡片战斗先导者 链环傀儡篇

anime.description: A few months have passed since the VF Circuit, and http://anidb.net/ch25900 [Aichi] is now in High School. However Aichi is in a different high school than most of his friends, a high school where the instructors focus on looking towards the future. One day Aichi admits he thinks Cardfight can be a future people can believe in, but in order to prove it Aichi must use his new deck, a deck in which Royal Paladins and Gold Paladins are combined as one force. Slowly but surely Aichi must gain friends through Cardfighting and help his new team win the newly formed high school cardfighting championships. Source: ANN

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: transfer student
tag.description: A transfer student is a student who changes from one institution or course to another at the same level. Their arrival, when not at the beginning of the school year, tends to cause a stir.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: demon
tag.description: In Western lore, demons are often described as minions from Hell, generally known to attack humans and feast on their flesh or possess the bodies of those with weak souls. In Eastern lore, on the other hand, they are generally supernatural, often but not always malevolent beings who can be more mischievous than actually evil, or simply supernatural spirits of no specific alignment.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: adoring fan club
tag.description: A character, group or characters, or an organisation is considered so awesome that a adoring fan club is formed to idolise them. Not only do they have notable admirers, but their fans become organised in such a fashion to have a following that could only be guaranteed in real life by precise and long increments of paparazzi-like stalking. If the character is sufficiently cool, an instant fan club may happen practically overnight (i.e., within a few episodes of them being introduced), although the subject of admiration typically has mixed feelings about the entire affair.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: スタンドアップ・ザ・ハイスクール!
Stand Up the High School!
Stand Up the High School!
episode.summary: The VF Circuit has been over for months, and Aichi`s life has returned to normal. He`s a high school student in a new school now, and is having trouble adjusting. When Ishida, a terminally foul-tempered student, follows him to Card Capital, will Aichi end up making a new friend? A rival? Or an enemy? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お前にブレイク
Catching a Break
Omae ni Break
episode.summary: When Aichi attempts to form a Cardfight Club at his high school, Kourin is his first recruit. But then she makes a rule to only let in students who beat her or Aichi in a match. Will they be the only two members? Or does Ishida stand a chance? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 狙われたアイドル
Targeted Idol!
Nerawareta Idol
episode.summary: It seems that Kourin has a stalker at school, and his name is Shingo. Naoki just wants to hit the guy, but Shingo insists on a Cardfight instead! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 初試合!宮地学園VS後江高校
First Match! Miyaji Academy vs. Hitsue High School!
Hatsu Shiai! Miyaji Gakuen vs. Hitsue Koukou
episode.summary: If Aichi`s Cardfight Club doesn`t beat Kai`s Vanguard Club in a series of intramural matches, they`ll have to disband! It`s a tall order to begin with, but making matters worse, the first match is between newbie Naoki and Kai! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 誕生!?カードファイト部
It Exists!? The Vanguard Club
Tanjou!? Cardfight-bu
episode.summary: The Cardfight Club needs just one more member to become an official club, but the deadline is only hours away! Misaki seems to be their best hope, but does she want to join? Will Kourin even agree to give her a shot? And even if the answer is yes to both... Misaki will have to fight and beat one of the strongest members of the club to be accepted! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アメフト部の刺客
The American Football Club`s Assassin
AmeFoot-bu no Shikaku
episode.summary: The Student Council doesn`t like how the Cardfight Club is making waves, so they send a Cardfighting member of the Football Club to crush Aichi before he can make his club official! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 助っ人は中学生!
The Ringer is a Middle School Student!
Suketto wa Chuugakusei!
episode.summary: Aichi`s Cardfight Club has to win three out of five matches against Kai`s high school team, or they`ll be forced to disband. The current count is 1-1, but in the third match, Misaki goes up against a familiar pint-sized "ringer." Whoever wins this match will be just one step away from victory! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 櫂の影
Kai`s Shadow!
Kai no Kage
episode.summary: In the final, decisive match of the intramural game against Hitsue High`s Vanguard Club, Aichi fights Morikawa, who`s a pushover except when he`s forced to use a balanced deck. But this time, the balanced deck is Kai`s! Does the deck make the fighter? Find out here! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 副部長はだれだ!?
Who`s the Co-Captain?!
Fukubuchou wa Dare Da!?
episode.summary: Picking the captain of the Cardfight Club is easy, but not so much with the vice-captain, when four (out of five) members want the same position. What to do in this situation? Stand up, Vanguard! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風との再会
Reunion with the Wind
Kaze to no Saikai
episode.summary: While taking a tour of Fukuhara High`s Vanguard Club to catch their eventual rivals in action, Aichi and his Cardfight Club witness two powerful combatants in a "friendly" match: AL4`s Assassin, Asaka and Leon Souryu! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイドルファイト
Idol Fight
Idol Fight
episode.summary: Rekka is the third member of the middle school Vanguard Fight Circle! Can Aichi preserve his club`s dignity by winning a match against her? Or is it already too late when Komoi falls head over heels for Rekka?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宮地学園中等部
Miyaji Academy, Middle School Division
Miyaji Gakuen Chuutou-bu
episode.summary: The middle school division of Miyaji Academy also has a Cardfight Club, helmed by Emi, her best friend, and a mystery member! But when Komoi and Naoki pay a surprise visit to give them some fighting "guidance," the question becomes... who schools whom? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 強豪 福原高校
Powerful Fighter at Fukuhara High!
Kyougou: Fukuhara Koukou
episode.summary: Naoki tries to prove himself by fighting Suiko! The return of an old frenemy of Aichi`s! And the promise of a formidable challenge ahead... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドキドキの文化祭
Exciting School Festival!
Dokidoki no Bunkasai
episode.summary: It`s time for Miyaji Academy`s school festival, and the Cardfight Club is going to participate... but the vice-president of the Student Council forces them to put on a play. Is Miyaji Academy ready for a fairy tale-Vanguard mash-up play, written and directed by Komoi? Will the vice-president derail their efforts and succeed in embarrassing Aichi and company? And who`s the surprise guest at the end?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝説の文化祭
Legendary School Festival!
Densetsu no Bunkasai
episode.summary: The legendary Cardfighter Daigo is back, and this time he`s in a match with Kourin. All eyes from Miyaji Academy are riveted on the fight, but will the Cardfight Club`s play have a happy ending?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 秘めたる闘志
Hidden Fighting Spirit!
Himetaru Toushi
episode.summary: The elimination round of the VF High School Championship begins with Aichi`s Miyaji Academy versus Hitsue High, home to heavy hitters like Kai and... Miwa?! Misaki learns just how strong Miwa can be in a fight when he`s totally serious about it! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 男の意地
A Man`s Guts!
Otoko no Iji
episode.summary: This is the match that decides which team gets cut from the VF High School Championship! It`s Aichi versus Izaki, normally not a nail-biting match-up, but Kai and Miwa have given Izaki special training beforehand... and on top of that, Izaki has a passionate reason of his own to beat Aichi! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 挑戦者[チャレンジャー]ナオキ
Challenger Naoki!
Challenger Naoki
episode.summary: It`s the beginning of the final round of the VF High School Championship, Kanto Block 3, with Aichi`s club pitted against Ren`s! First up is Naoki in a rematch against Suiko, who bested him only a few weeks earlier. Has Naoki gotten strong enough to beat one of the tough members of Ultra-rare?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝利への想い
Feelings About Victory!
Shouri e no Omoi
episode.summary: Two strong fighters, Kourin and Asaka Narumi (the "Beautiful Assassin"), face off for the second match of the Block 3 elimination finals. Both have a strong motivation to win, but what will be the deciding factor that tips the fight one way or the other? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人の頂上決戦
Showdown at the Summit
Futari no Choujou Kessen
episode.summary: It`s Aichi versus Ren and his Shadow Paladin deck! Has Ren returned to the dark side where he`s well-nigh omnipotent? If Aichi wins this match, the Cardfight Club will go on to the main VF High School Championship. Otherwise... better luck next year! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風の強い日
A Windy Day!
Kaze no Tsuyoi Hi
episode.summary: The Cardfight Club is back home from taking a premature stab at the VF High School Championship, and the Student Council is still plotting against them! This time, a wannabe club, the Paranormal Power Research Society, is pitted against the Vanguard Club with their clubroom on the line... except Aichi and company don`t answer the challenge. In fact, a rooftop battle ensues between the society`s leader and a Vanguard fighter with true power! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 謎のドラゴン
Mystery Dragon!
Nazo no Dragon
episode.summary: Aichi is unnerved when Kourin doesn`t show up for school. Later, Naoki stumbles onto a stunning discovery in the basement of the academy, then immediately runs to Card Capital to demand a fight with Aichi. Does Aichi stand a chance against this new, improved(?) Naoki with his powerful, never-before-seen card?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 呪縛[ロック]
Lock!
Lock
episode.summary: Bothered by Ishida`s peculiar behavior, Kai pays Takuto a visit to ask whether Cray has anything to do with it. Takuto fills Kai in on a dire situation that has roots in the previous arc. In fact, Kai can`t a-void being caught up in peril as he finds himself in a desperate Cardfight with his soul in the balance! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: "Я"-リバース-
Reverse!
"Reverse"
episode.summary: Kai is in the fight of his life against the possessed Takuto, with his soul lying in the balance. But when he`s given a choice, will Kai stay true to himself or opt for power? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒輪の力
The Power of the Black Ring!
Kokurin no Chikara
episode.summary: Possessed by the power of Link Joker, Kai goes to fight Tetsu, a person he deems worthy of passing it on. If Tetsu can`t successfully fend off this new, mysterious deck with its confounding power to "lock" cards, he`ll become infected too, and seek out other fighters... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暗雲 福原高校
Dark Clouds Over Fukuhara High School!
An`un: Fukuhara Koukou
episode.summary: All Ren wanted to do was check on Asaka and Tetsu, whom he swore to protect, but he`ll have to defeat the Reversed Suiko first... or end up being Reversed and under Void`s power himself! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 永遠(とわ)の操り人形(マリオネット)
Eternal Marionette!
Towa no Marionette
episode.summary: Ren and a Reversal-recovered Suiko finally find Asaka, but it`s too late: she`s been Reversed, too! Asaka throws down the gauntlet to Ren, and if he loses this match, he`ll be made into her mindless marionette. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラスト・ダンス
Last Dance
Last Dance
episode.summary: The battle between Ren and a Reversed Asaka reaches a fever pitch! If he loses, he`ll become a mindless slave (according to her). But if Ren wins, will Asaka ever live down the things she`s saying to him?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 裏切りの将軍[ジェネラル]
The Traitor General
Uragiri no General
episode.summary: As Ren fights his Reversed best friend, Tetsu, we go back several years to see how they first met, when Ren was a wide-eyed freshman and Tetsu was a juvenile delinquent brawler who wanted to have nothing to do with him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 月下のキングメーカー
Kingmaker in the Moonlight
Gekka no Kingmaker
episode.summary: The rooftop "boss battle" between Ren and Tetsu concludes here! Can Ren bring Tetsu back from the brink? And if so, what`s the next move? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダイユーシャ堕つ
Daiyusha Falls
Daiyuusha Otsu
episode.summary: Mitsusada returns from Singapore, only to be confronted at the airport by a strong Reversed fighter! In the meantime... Chris of Team Genius has been possessed by an unearthly power before. Can he withstand this, or will he become part of the outbreak of Reversed people? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ユリの勲章
Yuri`s Medal
Yuri no Kunshou
episode.summary: The Reversed Mitsusada intends to gather an army, and he`s already started with a Reversed Team Genius. Yuri will be the next one to succumb, unless she either beats her captain or somehow breaks through the mind control! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暗黒次元合体! "Я"ダイユーシャ
Dark Dimensional Combination! "Reverse" Daiyusha!
Ankoku Jigen Gattai! "Reverse" Daiyuusha
episode.summary: Koutei`s reign as "dark emperor" continues as he seeks to increase his Reversed subjects by three... Leon, Jillian, and Sharlene! Will Leon even make it to the VF High School Championship?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絆の舟
Tight-knit Ship
Kizuna no Fune
episode.summary: It`s the finale at the airport, with Leon as the last defense against Koutei and his small army of Reversed fighters. But now that Jillian and Sharlene have been Reversed too, will Leon be able to win on his own?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 林間学校
Camping Trip
Rinkan Gakkou
episode.summary: While the students of Miyaji Academy go on a trip, the Student Council members try to destroy the Cardfight Club`s reputation. Then, the gang watches the final match of the VF High School Championship between Ren and Leon! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 星空の下で...
Under the Starry Sky...
Hoshizora no Shita de...
episode.summary: Something seems to be wrong with Kourin during the school camping trip. And why did she just invite Aichi to the legendary romantic tree?! Meanwhile, after pulling an all-nighter of intensive Vanguard training, the president and vice-president of Student Council lurk around, waiting for the perfect chance to use their newfound Cardfighting prowess to take down Aichi`s club! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宮地にはためく海賊旗
The Pirate Flag Fluttering at Miyaji
Miyaji ni Hatameku Kaizokuki
episode.summary: On a visit to Miyaji Academy, Gouki and his pirate buddies get Reversed, then turn the school`s open house into a pirate recruiting effort. But before you can say "Arrrrr," Kamui arrives to put an end to the pirate factory and save Emi and Mai from certain peril! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カムイの拳(こぶし)
Kamui`s Fist
Kamui no Kobushi
episode.summary: Kamui hopes the fist of friendship will reverse the Reversed Gouki to normal! Emi and Mai are betrayed by a friend! And the old Ninja Master returns with a new name to take on a Reversed opponent of his own! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニンジャマスター復活
Ninja Master Returns
Ninja Master Fukkatsu
episode.summary: Hell hath no fury like Nagisa kept away from her beloved fixation, Kamui, but Ninja Master Neo is doing his best to stop her by using every last ninja technique he knows. Adding weight to the proceedings, of course, is that if the mysterious ninja hero fails, he`ll become Reversed just like Nagisa! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暴走天使[エンジェル]レッカ
Runaway Angel Rekka
Bousou Angel Rekka
episode.summary: Reversed Rekka wants to beat Kamui; Kamui wants to save Emi and Mai; and Reiji and Eiji have to beat an army of Reversed Rekka groupies! Can they do it?! HD, yo! (Highly doubtful...) Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トモダチ
Friends
Tomodachi
episode.summary: Even though his own best friends have turned against him, Kamui puts everything on the line to win back Emi and Mai`s friendship with Rekka. If he loses, her two "hostages" may just be Reversed too! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絶望へのカウントダウン
Countdown to Despair
Zetsubou e no Countdown
episode.summary: Kamui has one more fight to go... against the Reversed Kourin! Aichi and the other club members finally arrive at school, just in time to get a portentous message from Takuto. And a Reversed Kai finally gets back home after apparently criss-crossing the globe... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 混沌の破壊者
Chaotic Destroyer
Konton no Hakaisha
episode.summary: Aichi and the members of Cardfight Club are surrounded by Reversed fighters like Kamui and Kourin! Miwa fights the Reversed Kai in the name of friendship! And Takuto announces to all Cardfighters that the end of the world is at hand! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: それぞれの決意
Each One`s Determination
Sorezore no Ketsui
episode.summary: Jun, leader of the underground Cardfighting ring, decides to step up. His goal is to bring Kai back to normal, but he won`t even have that chance if the Reversed Miwa has anything to say about it. Meanwhile, when Aichi seems to have lost his groove, Ishida volunteers to help Leon Souryu take down Kai. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奪還せよ!! 宮地学園
Recapture Miyaji Academy
Dakkan Seyo!! Miyaji Gakuen
episode.summary: Unlikely friends Naoki and Shingo venture into the Reversed Miyaji Academy to turn everyone back to normal, but one of them loses and becomes Reversed himself! Only one is evil now, but which will win, Naoki or Shingo?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: すべてをブチ破れ!!
Smash Through Everything
Subete o Buchiyabure!!
episode.summary: Naoki gets a rematch against Nagashiro, the girl who once Reversed him! If he fails, Komoi, the president, and vice-president are all up for a Reversing, too! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイチとカムイ
Aichi and Kamui
Aichi to Kamui
episode.summary: Kamui faces his old friend and rival, Aichi. Of course, Kamui is Reversed, so not only is he more powerful, but jealousy comes to the fore! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 友情のかたち
The Form of Friendship
Yuujou no Katachi
episode.summary: It`s almost time for the big battle between Aichi and the Reversed Kai, but Miwa wants to fight Aichi first to test his worthiness. Aichi is game, but Misaki demands the chance to fight Miwa herself so she can be the one to bring him back! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人の先導者
The Two Leaders
Futari no Sendousha
episode.summary: The voluntarily Reversed Kai reveals to Aichi and company why he went over to the "dark side"... and then they have a Cardfight! Kai has something to prove, but Aichi just wants his friend and former mentor back. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絆の先に
Beyond the Bond
Kizuna no Saki ni
episode.summary: The fight between Aichi and Kai ends here, and it looks dire for Aichi! Also, Leon Souryu shows up with an unlikely ally! And who... or what... is Link Joker?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人のレオン
The Two Leons
Futari no Leon
episode.summary: When Takuto and Leon confront Takuto`s Link Joker double, Leon is teleported to another room, where he`s forced to fight a future version of himself. Specifically, a Leon who has given up and accepted the power of Reverse! Will the Leon of now be able to change his future, or is history (his story) doomed to repeat itself?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鎖裁つ者
The One Who Cuts Through Chains
Kusari Tatsu Mono
episode.summary: The true Takuto fights his double, who commands the power of Link Joker! While their fight rages on inside, Miwa, Misaki and the others battle a Reversed gang outside, whose power strengthens as the faux Takuto gets closer to winning... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: コーリン
Kourin
Kourin
episode.summary: Aichi vs. Kourin! Aichi vows to bring Kourin back to normal from her Reversed state, but she has her own reasons for wanting to win. Also, learn the truth behind Takuto`s connection with Ultra-rare! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: レンの望み
Ren`s Wish
Ren no Nozomi
episode.summary: Below, Tetsu and Asaka ward off a swarm of Reversed fighters. Far above, a climactic rooftop battle is taking place between the Reversed Kai and Ren as Aichi is forced to stand on the sidelines. Can Ren save the world? Or does that even matter to him while he`s fighting his former best friend and greatest rival? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 再誕の竜
Resurrection of the Dragon
Saitan no Ryuu
episode.summary: It`s the ultimate fight to the finish between Kai and Ren, but as the battle rages on, the Reversed Kai becomes... more like himself? Ren seems to have his opponent up against the ropes, but that`s before Kai brings out his game-changer... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 完全なりし黒輪
Perfect Black Ring
Kanzennarishi Kokurin
episode.summary: Aichi is the only one who can keep the evil Takuto from attaining the end of the world... and it all comes down to a Cardfight! But now Aichi knows that if he wins, Kourin will lose everything... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ワールドエンド
World End
World End
episode.summary: It seems the end of the world is now, with Link Joker units brought to life, swooping down and stealing lifeforce from people, while hordes of Reversed fighters try to pick off the last of the un-Reversed. The gate will open completely as soon as Aichi is beaten by Dark Takuto... and though the odds are stacked against him, Aichi holds on to one last bit of hope... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 交わる道
The Intersecting Path
Majiwaru Michi
episode.summary: Link Joker`s power has been banished from Earth and all Reversed fighters have been returned to normal. But then why is Aichi in a desperate fight against Kai on the roof of Takuto`s building? Whatever the outcome, Kai means for it to be their final battle! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 繋ぐもの
The Connected
Tsunagu Mono
episode.summary: In the finale of the Link Joker arc, Aichi`s epic battle with the Reversed Kai reaches its climax! Kai is determined to win and then disappear forever so he won`t ever be able to succumb to evil again. Aichi is just as determined to save his friend, no matter what it takes! Source: crunchyroll
